basic_info.description: I'm Lorenzo Carpaneto. Master's in Computer Science and Engineering. Here are some of the impactful changes I contributed to in my career:

projects.title: MaGrAct
projects.description: Developed MaGrAct, a tool for creating math animations.

projects.title: Blender
projects.description: I have developed a couple of Pull-Requests for the open source platform Blender.

projects.title: MSc Thesis
projects.description:
Sleep quality is a key aspect of our life: it influences our overall wellness and health. 
Even though it is such a relevant factor, the discussion on how to define it is still open, and there is no consensus. Over the years, many techniques have been developed to study it: some of them require the usage of sensors (also defined as objective techniques) others require the user to fill out questionnaires or use diaries (also defined as subjective techniques). 

In this thesis, we introduce a new framework to collect more, more reliable, and higher quality data regarding sleep: the main idea relies on combining subjective and objective measurements. Not only does the framework provide support to the user in completing the questionnaires, but it is also meant to help build applications that could be used for commercial purposes, clinical purposes, and also for other fields than sleep quality (such as user nutrition). 

We provide an implementation of such a framework in a proof-of-concept application and validate it against data collected from a user monitored for two months. 
Even though the validation is performed on a small dataset, the results obtained are promising: the framework is effective in helping the user filling the questionnaires and keeping track of their sleep quality. 
I have written a paper that will be published soon and it was presented at the IEEE conference ICHI

projects.title: LLVM
projects.description: I have entered the world of compilers, and developed a small PR for the LLVM project.

projects.title: Scarlet - Android Websocket
projects.description: Developed a demo of the Scarlet library to explain the library. Received positive comments on it by the community. The library is about websockets for Android and it has been developed by Tinder.

projects.title: SWERC
projects.description: In my third year of university, I have been selected to participate to SWERC, an international competition of competitive programming.

projects.title: Innovathon
projects.description: My team, I Turuk, placed second overall at this competition proposed by Leonardo S.p.A. We had to design and build a vehicle able to move autonomously inside of an ill-lit tunnel to assist injured people with an emergency kit.

projects.title: Flash Cards
projects.description: I have developed a multiplatform (ios, android) application in React Native using typescript.

projects.title: Python Games
projects.description: I have developed small python games using Pygame

projects.title: Clustering algorithm visualizer
projects.description: After attending the DataMining course, I was curious to understand how to make animations to visualize clustering algorithms... So I have created some python notebooks

projects.title: Masters of Renaissance
projects.description: As a project for a course in university, with a team of three people we have developed the client-server version of the game "Masters of Renaissance". In this project, we have implemented both a CLI and a GUI. The game could be played with a maximum of 4 players and the server was able to handle multiple games simoultaneously.

projects.title: SYP - Secure Your Place
projects.description: As a project for a course in university, with a team of three people we have developed a client-server application to monitor via a device with camera (e.g. raspberrypi) a room or an environment. The device was able to detect if people were in the room: if so, it would send a notification to the user. I have mainly worked on the live-streaming of the video: the server (developed with NodeJS) needed to put in communication the raspberry and the app on the android phone to let former one be able to stream the video. We decided not to publish the app because of the costs due to the server setup (and maintainance).

projects.title: Android simple tutorials
projects.description: Back in the days I was starting programming for Android. I have made some simple tutorials, both in Kotlin and Java, to show how to handle some basic situations (the link sends to the tutorial about ViewModel).
